text: The bar has a low ceiling and is surprisingly dark. Natives of Kristos, in their striking habsuit, huddle close to a spining contraption emiting a faint orange light as they enjoy drink in a somber mood. Other spacers dicuss softly around tables. A couple of officers, wearing what reminds you of hegemony uniform, drink together expensive drinks.
"We offer very legal mission, do you want to get super legal stuff from somewhere else?"

options: vanidad_rp_start:Ask about the getting legal stuff mission

text:
"Captain $playerName," $heOrShe says."

$HeOrShe  taps $hisOrHer datapad; a privacy field blurs and muffles the surroundings.

"I need stuff from $vanidad_rp_marketName, $vanidad_rp_dist light-years away. If I get stuff, $vanidad_rp_reward credits could be routed to your account."

 "this part of the dialog, you shouldnt see, since we are in a bar. But are you in?"

script:
AddText "You're being hailed by the $faction $otherShipOrFleet." $faction.baseColor
$hailing = true 0

text: "Captain" the $personRank looks tired and speak with little emotion. "You went and got material you should not have" $heOrShe raise a hand but stops, as if it was too much effort. "We will now proceed to destroy your fleet"

$heOrShe straighten a bit and scoff a little. "Well, some people would like that these material did not go and help terrorists. Some people would also like that legal commerce be not stopped unless theres an official investigation. So here we are." 

The $personRank sit back in his chair, as if saying this had drained all $hisOrHer energy.

options: 0:vanidad_rpAuthorityAvoid:Why are you telling me this, can we avoid fighting?

text:
The $personRank stay silent for a couple second. 

"Well " $heOrShe says in a depressed voice.
"Maybe if you were to give us whatever you went to pick, we might decide that its less paperwork that way." $HimOrHer voice picks up a little bit.
"yeah, let one of our shuttle board you and give us access to whatever you were asked to bring and I wont have the paperwork needed to record your untimely demise and to explain how we were not related"

options: 0:vanidad_rpAuthorityBetrayal:Allow a shuttle to come and pick up the package.

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile vanidad_rp true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
Call $entity.vanidad_rp_ref betrayal
Call $entity.vanidad_rp_ref updateStage
text: You send the signal and let a shuttle come board one of your ship. Inspector take sight of the things you were supposed to bring back and pick it up quickly. You get the feeling they do not care much about what it contains, but they do seem to know what they are looking for. Soon the shuttle depart and the fleet leaves.

"I was expecting someone to contact me soon enough." $personName reads a datapad, "You are captain $playerName picking up stuff for $vanidad_rp_missionGiverName am I right? Don't ya worry, we can deliver it, in fact I'm quite happy I don't have to keep it around anymore". $personFirstName send you coordinate for a delivery point on your datapad, it seems reasonably close.

At the dropoff point a small shuttle deliver you a couple boxes of material, it doesn't take much space. Some of your tech officers look into the "stuff" it contains, it's mostly specialised supply for machines none of them are familiar with. There is also a couple items of food that are quite expensive anywhere in the Core world.
options: cutCommLink: Go back to your ship

text: "Oh yeah, thats the stuff. Thanks for getting this for us." $PersonName says. "Authorities here can be so bothersome when a local citizen want to work on some personal project. I say we keep in touch, maybe I can find some other work for a captain like you"
A $manOrWoman in a native habsuit look at you and seem to invite you to $hisorHer booth.

options: vanidad_rp_startBar: Go sit in the booth with the VAO native.

text:
"Captain $playerName," $heOrShe says."

$HeOrShe  taps $hisOrHer datapad; a privacy field blurs and muffles the surroundings. The booth is maintained in a low orange light by a turning lamp, the kind VAO spacers are often fond of.
"I happen to know you by reputation" $HeOrShe pass you a glass of a strange slimy drink. "To fruitfull even if pointless deals!"

$HeOrShe drink from $himOrHer cup quickly. Then $heOrShe says:
 I need some stuff that is stashed on $vanidad_rp_marketName, $vanidad_rp_dist light-years away. If I get that stuff, $vanidad_rp_reward credits could fint their way to your account."

 "Do we have a deal?"

options:
0:contact_acceptBar:Yea sure
contact_declineBarNoContinue: I don't think so

text:
The $manOrWoman lean a bit on the table toward you and speak with a slow reassuring voice. "Oh, nothing illegal. Do not worry, it's mostly parts to maintain the machines around here. Maybe a bit of food, to keep moral. I reckon It wouldn't take much space in your ship.

I'm not fond of flying, I know you should look out for pirates and anything that could bother you. I pay generously that you may take the risk instead of me. But you don't look like the kind of person that is worried by that."

There's a pause that linger in the air for an instant, as $heOrShe expects an answer from you.

script:
AddText "You're being hailed by the $faction $otherShipOrFleet." $faction.baseColor
$hailing = true 0

text:
A haggard $personRank of the VAO sit in the middle of the screen with what look look like a civilian scientist standing to its right. 
"Captain, we are sorry to announce that according to the rules of scavenging this derelict has been claimed by us. We are not afraid to open fire should you try to temper with it."

options: vanidad_loeAuthorityHostile: Well we really need that ship, and we are not afraid to use force.
vanidad_loeAuthorityPeacefull: I happen to really need that ship, maybe we can come to an arrangement?
cutCommLink:We will be on our way then (cut the Comm Link)

text:
The $personRank slump back in $hisOrHer chair with an audible sigh. 
"Well so do we. You are more than welcome to test our weapons if you want"
$HeorShe then nonchalantly let $hisOrHer arm fall on the console the the comm is cut.
ok i guess

"Well.. Captain" the $personRank gives a dejected look towards the scientist standing beside him. "we happen to be on some kind of official business, so unless you got some convincing arguments, I think we don't have much to say".

options: vanidad_loeAuthorityAskPossibilityBribe:Maybe I could pay you an acceptable amount?

text:
$HeOrShe stay silent, only typing some thing on the console, before answering in a soft voice.
"That doesn't seem to be something we can do"
While he sits there looking at you awkwardly, you receive a private channel comm message, where all that is written is: "$vanidad_loe_authorityPayment credits and you can do whatever you want"
options:
vanidad_loeAuthorityPayBribe: Transfer the amount to the linked account
vanidad_loeAuthorityCommPeaceHub: Lets think about this

script:
Call $entity.vanidad_loe_ref clearedAuthority
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
RemoveCommodity credits $vanidad_loe_authorityPayment
$entity.vanidad_loe_authority_silent = true
text:
You transfer the specified amount as quick as you can while the scientist looks puzzled at the silent communication. When you receive confirmation the comm cuts for 30 second.
When the video feed comes back up, the $personRank is now alone in the screen.
"Well, I think our work here is done, good luck out there captain"
You have interacted with the target
Your $shipOrFleet makes a pass by the derelict, allowing your sensors officer to give it a cursory scan. Identity of target is verified positive.

Your $shipOrFleet makes a pass by the derelict, allowing your sensors officer to give it a cursory scan. Identity of target is verified positive, but with hostiles nearby  you can't safely dispatch a salvage teams to investigate.

Your $shipOrFleet makes a pass by the derelict, allowing your sensors officer to give it a cursory scan. Identity of the target is verified positive, however the closely orbiting fleet sends comm warnings that you should not attempt to get any closer to the target. No one wants to try to interact with the derelict until this looming threat is dealt with.

Your $shipOrFleet makes a pass by the derelict, allowing your sensors officer to give it a cursory scan. Identity of target is verified positive, and while there is a fleet that seemed interested in this derelict, it is currently engaged in a battle. We have a small window to operate on the target, but if the other fleet survive their battle they are likely to turn hostile.

Your $shipOrFleet intercepts the derelict and the sensors officer runs a full-spectrum active scan. This ship has probably been stranded here since the Collapse. You order telemetry logged to the mission report file so that if nothing is found, at least you can prove you found the ship.

A salvage team is dispatched and they quickly breach the hull. The operating screen fills with camera feeds. Heavily decayed bodies are scattered across the ship, their jumpsuits bearing the insignia of the $vanidad_loe_targetNoArticle. Most onboard memory has been scrubbed clean by time and the harsh stellar environment; however, your info mentions a specially shielded black box containing the ship's telemetry up to its moment of demise. Once located, you order your crewman to take the entire container onboard and secure it in the shuttle bay.

You consider trying to open it, but it would risk damaging the contents, and in any case they are most likely heavily encrypted. All that remains is to bring it back to your client.

A haggard spacer with pale and unhealthy skin sits down unsteadily beside you and mutters: "A friend of mine might have a profitable proposition for an intrepid captain.". He points towards a booth drenched in orange lighting at the back of the bar before shifting his attention towards the barkeep in order to get himself a drink.

options: vanidad_loeStartBar:Go sit in the orange-hued booth the spacer pointed out to you.

text:
As you go and sit in the booth, it is immediately obvious to you that the light comes from one of those spinning light fixtures the VAO natives seem to plaster just about everywhere. In front of you sits a $manOrWoman with sickly white skin, wearing a VAO Habsuit decorated with a few discrete Luddic Church symbols. $HeOrShe doesn't stop looking at $hisOrHer datapad until you are fully seated.

"It seems I might have found a Captain with an enterprising mind." $heOrShe says as she pretends to notice your presence just now.$HeOrShe taps $hisOrHer datapad and isolates the dimly lit booth from the bustle of the bar. 

"A friend of mine is an Archeo engineer on the Debajo Del Sol station and found some interesting data about the presumed location of $vanidad_loe_target_text from the pre collapse Vanidad y Afflication Operation. 
If you were to go and grab the ship black box in the $vanidad_loe_target_system , $vanidad_loe_dist light-years away, and bring it here, I would be happy to forward $vanidad_loe_reward credits to your account."

 "What do you think?"

options:
0:contact_acceptBar:We have a deal.
1:contact_declineBarNoContinue:I am quite busy, maybe another time.
0:vanidad_loeOfferBarHub_ODanger: Seems a lot of money for some old info you know were to find.

text:
$HeOrShe frowns a little before letting out a sigh with a fake smile on $hisOrHer face.

"I do believe Ludd rewards the inquisitive mind, so I don't mind sharing a bit with you."

"First, you have to understand that we might not be the only party with this information. Second, we..I care very much about the past and the purpose of our VAO's ancestor. Some of those other parties care more about technologies and resources, so I'm paying to make sure this falls into the proper hands, no matter who or what gets in your way." 
$HeOrShe pauses a little.
"With all that said, are you still willing to do it?"

"I am happy that my faith in you was well placed." $PersonName says. "My team will now work on seeing if we can extract something useful out of there. If you want, feel free to contact me again, I might have some more work for a reliable Captain like you."
